contentrichtext.text: {{tocright}} ==Government and politics== * Sir [[John Kerr (governor-general)]] (1914–1991), Australian Governor-General * [[John Kerr (US politician)]] (c. 1778–1823), Irish-born mayor of Columbus, Ohio * [[John Leeds Kerr]] (1780–1844), U.S. Senator from Maryland * [[John Kerr (Virginia Congressman)]] (1782–1842), Virginia politician * [[John Kerr, 7th Marquess of Lothian]] (1794–1841), Scottish politician and peer * [[John Bozman Kerr]] (1809–1878), U.S. Representative from Maryland * [[John Kerr, Jr. (congress)]] (1811–1879), Congressional Representative and jurist from North Carolina * [[John Kerr (British politician)]] (1852–?), UK MP for Preston, 1903–1906 * Sir [[John Henry Kerr]] (1871–1934), colonial governor in British India * [[John H. Kerr]] (1873–1958), Congressman from North Carolina in the 20th century * [[John H. Kerr, III]] (born 1936), North Carolina politician * [[John Kerr (Nelson politician)]] (1830–1898), New Zealand (Nelson) politician * [[John Kerr (Auckland politician)]], New Zealand (Auckland) politician ==Scientists== * [[John Glasgow Kerr]] (1824–1901), physician and medical missionary * Rev. [[John Kerr (physicist)]] (1824–1907), Scots physicist * [[John Martin Munro Kerr]] (1868–1960), Scottish professor of midwifery * Sir [[John Graham Kerr]] (1869–1957), Scottish embryologist and Member of Parliament ==Sport== * [[John Kerr (Scottish cricketer)]] (1885–1972), Scottish cricketer from Greenock * [[John Kerr (baseball)]] (1898–1993), American baseball player * [[Jack Kerr (cricketer)]] (John Lambert Kerr, 1910–2007), New Zealand cricketer * [[John Kerr (figure skater)]] (born 1980), Scottish ice dancer * [[John Kerr, Sr.]] (1943–2011), Scottish-born Canadian soccer player * [[John Kerr, Jr. (soccer)]] (born 1965), his son, American soccer player * [[John Kerr (sailor)]] (born 1951), Canadian sailor * [[John Kerr (American football)]] (born 1981), American football player * [[Johnny "Red" Kerr]] (1932–2009), professional basketball player * [[John Kerr (rugby union)]], Scottish rugby union player * [[John Kerr (Australian footballer)]] (born 1934), Australian rules footballer * [[John Kerr (footballer born 1959)]] (1959–2006), footballer for Tranmere Rovers, Bristol City, Stockport County and Bury * [[Jack Kerr (ice hockey)]] (1863–?), Canadian ice hockey player and athlete ==Armed forces== * Sir [[John Kerr (Royal Navy officer)]] (born 1937), British admiral * [[John Chipman Kerr]] (1887–1963), Canadian Victorian Cross recipient * [[John Brown Kerr]] (1847–1926), United States Army brigadier general and Medal of Honor recipient ==Other== * [[John Kerr (singer)]] (c. 1925–2006), Irish ballad singer * [[John Kerr (actor)]] (1931-2013), American actor and lawyer * [[John Kerr (broadcaster)]] (born 1942), Australian radio broadcaster * [[John Kerr, Baron Kerr of Kinlochard]] (born 1942), British diplomat * [[John Kerr (author)]] (born 1950), American author * [[John Kerr (JK)]] (born 1981), British Businessman * [[John C. Kerr]] (born 1944), Canadian businessman * John Law Kerr, architect of the [[Radium Springs, Georgia]] golf course {{hndis|Kerr, John}}
